item.title: Security threat prompting PM evacuation linked to intimidation of Chinese dancers
item.description: The prime minister was forced to evacuate the Lodge last night due to a bomb threat linked to performances in Australia by a classical Chinese dance and music group that is banned in China.

item.title: Sydney doctor Jamal Rifi says IS-linked families in Syria should return
item.description: Australian doctor Jamal Rifi has been helping to coordinate a potential repatriation effort from Syria, including by obtaining passports for the families.

item.title: Australian man Peter Williams given seven years' jail for selling US trade secrets to Russian broker
item.description: A judge in Washington has sentenced Australian man Peter Williams to 87 months in prison for selling sensitive information to a Russian broker.

item.title: Cull and swimming ban resume after fatal shark attack in New Caledonia
item.description: New Caledonian authorities ban beach swimming and resume shark culling despite concern from environmental groups, after a wing foiler is killed in an attack.

item.title: Woman's family sues NT government over Tennant Creek watch house death
item.description: The family of a woman who died in police custody in Tennant Creek is suing the Northern Territory government for negligence, alleging officers failed in their duty of care after her arrest and that the 44-year-old was held in an "overheated" cell.

item.title: NSW premier flags new laws after IS-inspired attacks on gay and bisexual teens
item.description: The New South Wales premier has flagged harsher punishments and new criminal offences in response to gay and bisexual teens being lured online and bashed on camera.

item.title: Payne Haas rejects Michael Maguire rumour in NRL move from Broncos to Rabbitohs
item.description: Payne Haas speaks publicly for the first time about his move to South Sydney in 2027, explaining why he is leaving the Brisbane Broncos.

item.title: Southern Downs Regional Council rejects developer's proposal for water bottling facility on Cherrabah
item.description: Farmers say their fight continues after the local council knocked back a Chinese company's bid to extract almost 100 million litres of groundwater a year to bottle and sell.

item.title: What is duty sex and how do you stop having it?
item.description: Obligatory or duty sex is most common in long-term relationships, but can also happen in casual relationships where sex is the basis of the connection.

item.title: Connor Rogers learning to walk again after terrifying knee injury
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Troy Maskell found guilty of 73-year-old Strathmerton postmaster's manslaughter in retrial
item.description: A jury has found Troy Matthew Maskell guilty of a 73-year-old Strathmerton postmaster's manslaughter during a retrial ordered due to inadmissible evidence.

item.title: Alleged bomb threat against Gold Coast's HOTA theatre over Chinese dance group
item.description: Shen Yun has been the subject of several threats, including one against Australia's prime minister on Monday.

item.title: Angus Taylor says federal Liberals must 'do better' as he joins Ashton Hurn in Adelaide
item.description: Opposition leader Angus Taylor responds to SA Liberal leader Ashton Hurn's criticism of her federal counterparts, as he joins her on the state campaign trail in Adelaide.

item.title: AFL says umpires' opinion still matters after announcing Brownlow Medal voting change
item.description: The AFL confirms umpires will be able to access player statistics before casting their votes in a bid to quell any controversy around the Brownlow Medal count.

item.title: Rhys Bellinge manslaughter sentence supported by Roger Cook, but Basil Zempilas disagrees
item.description: WA's political leaders are at odds over the sentence given to obstetrician Rhys Bellinge for a fatal drunken car accident, with Premier Roger Cook backing it and Opposition Leader Basil Zempilas saying it was "on the light side."

item.title: Suspects arrested in relation to kidnapping murder of Chris Baghsarian
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Canberra man accused of sexually assaulting woman he held captive tells jury he was under attack
item.description: A man accused of holding a woman captive and sexually assaulting her until she fled naked into a Canberra street has told a jury he was the one under attack.

item.title: Police find car of alleged Mullewa shooter Kenneth John Giles
item.description: Police find a white Nissan Patrol belonging to alleged gunman Kenneth John Giles nearly two months after he allegedly shot his partner and sparked a major manhunt.

item.title: Teenager first in SA to be prosecuted for allegedly creating deepfake images
item.description: A suppression order has been lifted on the identity of the first South Australian man to be prosecuted for allegedly creating and sharing sexually explicit deepfake images.

item.title: Matildas goalkeeper Mackenzie Arnold unfazed by minimal preparation ahead of Asian Cup
item.description: Mackenzie Arnold says she has enough game time and form behind her to perform in Australia's Asian Cup tilt.

item.title: Edith Cowan University's $853 million Perth CBD campus evacuated three days into first semester
item.description: The brand new Edith Cowan University precinct in Perth's CBD is evacuated, with hundreds of students pouring into city streets just three days into the first semester.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Evelyn Araluen wins $100,000 Victorian Prize for Literature for poetry collection, The Rot
item.description: Eveyln Araluen has taken out the top award at the Victorian Premier's Literary Awards for The Rot, the follow up to her award-winning debut, Dropbear.

item.title: Commonwealth Bank prepares for the AI revolution
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Algal bloom report blames 'convergence' of factors, but ecologist questions flood finding
item.description: The SA environment minister says preliminary results of an investigation into the causes of the harmful algal bloom back up what scientists had long suspected, but an ecologist who has criticised the government's response says more detail needs to be released.

item.title: Khaled Sabsabi to exhibit two new works at Venice Biennale after controversial dumping and reinstatement
item.description: Last year, Khaled Sabsabi was dumped from the Venice Biennale to avoid "divisive debate". Now, he announces his work will feature in both the main exhibition and the Australia Pavilion.

item.title: Man dies, woman in hospital following unit fire at St Marys, Western Sydney
item.description: A man dies and a woman is taken to hospital in a serious but stable condition after a unit fire at St Marys in Sydney's west.

item.title: First home buyer affordability slips further, new real estate report shows
item.description: The Australian dream of home ownership is becoming an increasingly unrealistic goal for young Australians, new research from Domain has found, with repayments on an entry-level house now averaging almost half a couple's combined income.

item.title: Bomb threat against Albanese underscores how complex security has become
item.description: It's tempting to treat the evacuation of the prime minister from the Lodge this week as a bizarre outlier but that would miss the point.

item.title: Call to find paintings by Tasmanian colonial-era artist William Charles Piguenit
item.description: Experts believe "countless" artworks by a famed colonial artist could be sitting in Tasmanian homes, with the owners unaware of their true value.

item.title: Mamma Mia! star Amanda Seyfried tackles her wildest musical yet
item.description: The Oscar-nominated star adored working with director Mona Fastvold to resurrect an astonishing religious figure in The Testament of Ann Lee.

item.title: More Australians switching to 'riskier' super funds, as industry calls for tighter regulation
item.description: More young Australians with less super are moving away from tightly regulated super funds to platform-based or self-managed super funds.

item.title: Labor's capital gains hints are getting less subtle, but will the compromises be worth it?
item.description: The hints are getting less subtle and Labor's plans on capital gains tax are becoming clearer, but a proposal laden with compromises risks undermining any intergenerational argument.

item.title: Australia's first Deafblind class created in mainstream public school
item.description: Australia's first Deafblind class in a mainstream school has been established after a mother spent two years advocating for her son.

item.title: WARNING: DISTRESSING FOOTAGE Young man kicked unconscious in IS-inspired homophobic attack
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Suspected serial offender linked to Islamic State walks free over filmed gay bashing
item.description: A suspected serial violent homophobe linked to an Islamic State terrorist network has walked free on probation after pleading guilty to a brutal snuff-video-style gay bashing.

item.title: Female athletes found to fear 'nothing is going to happen' when speaking out on gender-based violence
item.description: Experiences shared by athletes who participated in the ABC's Elite Athletes in Australian Women's Sport survey found many fear "nothing is going to happen" when speaking out on gender-based violence and harassment.

item.title: Boy, 10, in serious condition after e-scooter struck by car in South Granville, Sydney
item.description: A 10-year-old boy remains in a serious condition after he was struck by a car while riding an e-scooter in Sydney's western suburbs.

item.title: Adelaide theatre company Slingsby says funding loss forces final curtain call
item.description: Key figures from Adelaide-based family theatre company Slingsby have decided to let the curtain drop for the final time after missing out on federal government funding.

item.title: Larry Summers to resign from Harvard over Jeffrey Epstein ties
item.description: The former US Treasury secretary says it was a "difficult decision" and he will leave at the end of the academic year.

item.title: Support options for those who receive inappropriate medical treatment for endometriosis
item.description: If allegations that a surgeon performed surgery for "severe" endometriosis on women with little or no sign of the disease have you questioning your own treatment, here is where you can voice your concerns.

item.title: Brisbane could fall behind in student accommodation supply, warns Property Council of Australia
item.description: It is no secret finding a rental as a university student can be a challenge. Some are opting for purpose-build accommodation instead, but this major city could be at risk of falling behind in its supply.

item.title: Why Australia has become an unlikely getaway for South Korea's biggest baseball teams
item.description: Australia emerges as an unlikely getaway for some of South Korea's biggest baseball stars.

item.title: Iceland to hold referendum on joining EU a decade after abandoning membership talks
item.description: In 2013, Reykjavik abandoned EU membership talks after four years of negotiations, but rising living costs and the ongoing war in Ukraine have rekindled the island nation's interest in joining the bloc.

item.title: New Zealand knocks Sri Lanka out of Twenty20 World Cup in super eight match in Colombo
item.description: New Zealand knocks tournament co-hosts Sri Lanka out of the Twenty20 World Cup with a 61-run win in their super eights game in Colombo.

item.title: Expanded Newcastle Art Gallery finally opens after decades of turmoil
item.description: It has been two decades in the making, but the troubled Newcastle Art Gallery expansion is finally opening its doors.

item.title: Guide to Listening: ABC Classic's Festival of Female Composers and International Women's Day on ABC Jazz
item.description: For 10 years, in the lead-up to International Women's Day, ABC Classic has celebrated classical music by women across centuries. Here's what's in store for 2026.

item.title: Prosecutor's breach of WA evidence rules triggers retrial for man accused of child sex offences
item.description: A man found guilty of sexually abusing his stepdaughters wins a retrial because a "serious breach" by a prosecutor resulted in a "miscarriage of justice".

item.title: Gary Foley Collection tells activism history through Aboriginal lens
item.description: The ABC gets a rare look at the Aboriginal History Archive, a little-known collection of thousands of items collected by the well-known activist Gary Foley.

item.title: Australians fear falling victim to AI-related crimes, deepfakes and hacks, research shows
item.description: More than half of Australian adults are worried about AI being used to cause them harm, and almost as many fear falling victim to a crime enabled by the technology, a report found.

item.title: What is Shen Yun, the group named in a threat against Prime Minister Anthony Albanese?
item.description: Police are investigating a bomb threat against a Gold Coast theatre hosting a classical Chinese dance group after a threat was also made against the prime minister's official residence.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: US tariffs on Australia remain at 10 per cent — for now
item.description: Trade Minister Don Farrell hopes Australia can dodge a higher tariff rate being imposed by the US, saying trade officials overnight confirmed the tariff rate on Australia would remain at 10 per cent — at least for now.

item.title: New Shanghai Chinese restaurant in Katherine rocked by pre-dawn machete attack, carjacking
item.description: A Top End Chinese restaurant manager says the eatery's staff have left town after its chef was allegedly threatened with a knife in a pre-dawn carjacking.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup 2026: Philippines up for the fight against the Matildas in tournament opener
item.description: The last time the Filipinas faced Australia they were trounced 8-0. But they have a renewed side and spirit, and are ready to push the Matildas all the way in the first Women's Asian Cup game in Perth.

item.title: RBA governor Michele Bullock calls for patience as rate decisions get harder
item.description: Michelle Bullock gives more details on how quickly developments affecting monetary policy have moved since the middle of last year.

item.title: Teenager Jeremy Webb died of meat allergy from tick bites, coroner finds
item.description: Teenager Jeremy Webb's death in 2022 is the first documented fatal case of mammalian meat allergy in the country and second in the world.

item.title: Former Australian of the Year Grace Tame responds to Anthony Albanese's 'difficult life' apology
item.description: Grace Tame criticises Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's qualified apology after he described her as "difficult", saying "what a patronising cop-out".

item.title: INXS nominated for induction into Rock & Roll Hall of Fame
item.description: INXS will be considered for induction into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame and is one of 10 first-time nominees on the ballot.

item.title: Concerns over Medicare changes restricting rural mental health treatment
item.description: A regional patient and psychologists say changes to Medicare restricts access to telehealth and video psychologist services.

item.title: Gas giant Arrow Energy takes Australia's biggest pork producer to court over gas pipelines
item.description: A major energy company is taking Australia's largest pork producer to court over plans to build gas pipelines through its property on Queensland's Western Downs.

item.title: US women's ice hockey captain Hilary Knight disappointed by men's team's call with Donald Trump
item.description: Members of the US women's ice hockey team respond to Donald Trump's phone call with the men's team after both won Winter Olympics gold.

item.title: The AFL's ruck rule changes spark fears of an injury influx as Shannon Neale limps off in preseason
item.description: Geelong's Shannon Neale might have escaped a serious injury, but coaches and players are beginning to voice concerns the AFL's rule changes could lead to more rucks getting hurt.

item.title: Sunset Strip residents learn water unsafe even for washing in after 66 years using it to brush teeth
item.description: Residents in Sunset Strip knew their water was not safe to drink, but it came as a great shock to read a letter stating it was not safe to bathe in or wash with either.

item.description: More former patients of Melbourne gynaecologist Simon Gordon have come forward to express distress over their treatment with many joining a newly-formed private support group.

item.description: The Supreme Court of Victoria hears the former Jetstar pilot's application to be bailed ahead of his retrial over the alleged 2020 murder of Carol Clay in Victoria's High Country.

item.description: A Senate committee hears bombshell testimony about Optus's processes during an outage that led to the deaths of multiple customers who were unable to call Triple Zero.

item.description: The fate of the "ISIS brides" is inextricably linked to constitutional facts but the debate about their future is not taking place in a legal chamber — it is being fought in the court of public opinion.

item.description: Qantas' first-half profit result has disappointed shareholders, but chief executive Vanessa Hudson says the airline's largest fleet renewal in history will pay off.

item.description: Most Australians will receive a mobile phone alert in July this year, as part of a nationwide test of a new emergency warning system.

item.description: Hong Kong's Court of Appeal overturns the lower court ruling against Jimmy Lai on a fraud offence.

item.title: Christopher Turner jailed over fatal gas mix-up at Bankstown-Lidcombe Hospital
item.description: Newborn John Ghanem died, while baby Amelia Khan suffered severe and permanent brain damage when they were inadvertently given nitrous oxide instead of oxygen after their births.

item.description: An 89-year-old man dies in hospital after being struck by a car in Lyneham earlier this month.

item.description: Five-time World Chess Champion Viswanathan Anand says he believes Australia could be on the verge of becoming a proud chess nation.

item.title: What is mammalian meat allergy and how do you develop it?
item.description: Jeremy Webb's death in 2022 from a tick-induced red meat allergy is the first to be recorded in Australia. Here's what we know about mammalian meat allergy and how to avoid it.

item.description: Mother and daughter citizen scientists find what is believed to be the largest coral colony on the Great Barrier Reef and possibly in the world.

item.title: How an onstage clash between a future NT administrator and a political hopeful drew battle lines
item.description: A keynote speaker shoved an environmental activist at a conference in 2023. Now, one of them is the Northern Territory's next administrator.

item.description: Rowers have had to move their training and a boat operator has held off bookings after high levels of E. coli were detected alongside dead fish on a stretch of the River Torrens in Adelaide.

item.description: Forty farming families and five processors have secured live sheep transition funding from more than 260 applicants, including Beaufort River Meats in the Great Southern, which has temporarily shut down amid ongoing livestock shortages.

item.description: The demonstrators are arguing in the state's highest court that the laws introduced by Premier Chris Minns after the Bondi Beach terror attack should be ruled unconstitutional.

item.description: Grape growers have endured a tough few years and there are hopes that a national database will help to improve the industry's fortunes.

item.description: Business managers and researchers are concerned that a sharp decline in tobacco sales in Alice Springs could mean more people are taking up smoking illegal tobacco.

item.description: Ash Gardner says mastering a simple game plan was the key to Australia's convincing six-wicket win over India in the ODI series opener Brisbane.

item.description: A teenager who scaled a crane and became stuck in Melbourne's north-east has been rescued by firefighters who brought in an expert team to help him down to safety.

item.description: Police recorded 197 incidents of LGBTQIA+ hate-related violence and charged 103 people over the attacks since 2023.

item.title: Police charge 25 over 'family-run drug syndicate' seizing $3m in drugs at Gladstone
item.description: Dozens of people are charged after a raid in central Queensland seized more than $3 million worth of drugs from what people say was a "deeply entrenched drug syndicate".

item.title: Labor not ruling out negative gearing changes
item.description: A government source said it would make sense to consider changes to negative gearing and capital gains tax together, but that no decision was close to being made.

item.title: Judge rejects request to block Trump White House from building its $560 million ballroom project
item.description: A US judge rejects a preservationist group's request to block the Trump administration from continuing construction of a $560 million ballroom to replace the demolished East Wing of the White House.

item.title: Hillary Clinton speaks after testifying about Epstein ties
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Tens of thousands of Budget Direct customers overcharged, ASIC alleges
item.description: The corporate regulator is taking legal action over allegations Budget Direct customers lost online discounts they were promised and were overcharged.

item.title: Royal Australian Mint unveils new limited edition $1 coin with subtle change to mark 60 years of decimal currency
item.description: The Royal Australian Mint releases a limited edition $1 coin to mark the 60th anniversary of the introduction of decimal currency.

item.title: ABC to broadcast Matildas' Women's Asian Cup games as well as knockout matches
item.description: Just days out from the start of the Women's Asian Cup, the ABC has locked in radio broadcasting rights for the tournament.

item.title: Sydney solicitor accused of stealing $15 million from clients
item.description: Police had been investigating Benjamin Paul Reid at a Bondi Junction law firm since September last year.

item.title: $3 million in drugs seized in Gladstone drug trafficking operation
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Deepfakes back in the headlines after a federal law was used for the first time
item.description: As the first case under new anti-deepfake legislation goes before the courts, authorities and experts say the rise in the creation of the non-consensual sexually explicit material is concerning.

item.title: Air strikes hit Afghan capital of Kabul, hours after Taliban attacks Pakistan
item.description: Pakistan is responding to "unprovoked fire" by Afghan forces at multiple locations along the border, the Information Ministry in Islamabad says.

item.title: Netflix declines to raise offer for Warner, paving way for Paramount takeover
item.description: Netflix has declined to raise its offer to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studio and streaming business, in a stunning move that effectively puts Paramount in a position to take over the fellow storied Hollywood giant.

item.title: Protestor arrested as NT Administrator David Connolly sworn in
item.description: A protester has been arrested amid chaotic scenes outside of NT Parliament, where David Connolly has been sworn in as the new administrator.

item.title: 171 bodies found in mass graves in eastern Congo after withdrawal of M23 rebel group
item.description: Mass graves with at least 171 dead bodies have been found in the eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo, in a region the M23 rebel group has recently withdrawn from.

item.title: Bendigo Swordcraft rallies around one of their own after Harcourt bushfire
item.description: Michael Henry's armour and weapons survived January's bushfires, as the Swordcraft community helps him rise from the ashes.

item.title: Instagram to alert parents if teens 'repeatedly' search for self-harm terms
item.description: The new feature will be rolled out in Australia from next week, but there are concerns about loopholes and limitations.

item.title: Authorities 'planning for the worst' for downpour to hit northern SA
item.description: South Australia's emergency services are on high alert ahead of possible intense rainfall of up to 120 millimetres in parts of the state, which may lead to flash flooding.

item.title: WA drivers reeling after passengers caught out by AI-powered safety cameras
item.description: WA drivers given large fines or a licence suspension after their passengers were snapped wearing seatbelts incorrectly say they are being punished for behaviour beyond their control.

item.title: Alleged terrorist who stabbed Sydney bishop diagnosed with schizophrenia
item.description: A teenager who slipped the intelligence net and stabbed a Sydney bishop in an alleged terrorist attack 20 months before the Bondi Beach massacre has been diagnosed with schizophrenia, a court hears.

item.title: How Manly backrower Hugo Hart went from American high school football to the brink of the NRL
item.description: After some eye-catching performances in the pre-season, young Manly backrower and former American high school football linebacker Hugo Hart is edging closer to an NRL debut.

item.title: Tasmania's finances to 'rapidly deteriorate', Treasury warns, with state unable to grow its way out of trouble
item.description: Tasmania's Department of Treasury and Finance has issued a dire warning about the state's finances, and says there are no easy fixes.

item.title: Baby rhino born in NSW wildlife park
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Riverina community steps up to feed baby rhino after mum abandons him at birth
item.description: Just like "Punch" the monkey, this adorable baby was abandoned by its mother soon after birth.

item.title: In photos: Extreme weather sweeps across large parts of Australia
item.description: At least four states are facing extreme weather and heavy rain, with some areas tipped to receive the heaviest rainfall in more than a decade.

item.title: Western Sydney youth tell their stories of postcode wars via play
item.description: Jaani Pani knows how loyalty to a postcode can shape your life in Western Sydney. He is telling his story for the stage to inspire the next generation.

item.title: Federal MP Tim Wilson's event gatecrashed by ethno-nationalist group National Workers Alliance
item.description: Police said they were called to the scene after the National Workers Alliance, an ethno-nationalist organisation, gatecrashed a community event held by Shadow Treasurer Tim Wilson in Melbourne on Thursday night.

item.title: Terella Brewing to close amid legal battle with Sunshine Coast Council
item.description: Popular Sunshine Coast brewery and music venue Terella Brewing will close after a legal stoush with the local council.

item.title: Comedian Magda Szubanski in remission after stage 4 blood cancer treatment
item.description: The Australian entertainer reveals she is in remission after completing chemotherapy treatment for stage 4 blood cancer.

item.title: Crew-11 NASA astronaut behind mission-ending medical issues identifies himself
item.description: The 58-year-old spaceflight veteran has identified himself as the astronaut whose illness prompted NASA's first medical evacuation.

item.title: Australian Electoral Commission proposes changes to Tasmanian voting boundaries
item.description: Under proposed changes to Tasmania's electorates, Lyons would decrease in area while Clark would increase.

item.title: Coles 'Down Down' in the supermarket wars
item.description: Financial results for supermarket giant Coles underperform, with stocks following suite.

item.title: Mitch Brown co-hosts Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras six months after coming out as bisexual
item.description: Just six months since coming out, ex-AFL player Mitch Brown is now co-hosting Sydney's Mardi Gras parade. He hopes his journey can help other players embrace who they are.

item.title: Health authorities reject claims Sydney hospital fungal infection outbreak covered up
item.description: Health authorities reject claims information about a fungal infection outbreak which could have caused the death of two patients at a Sydney hospital was deliberately withheld from the public.

item.title: After day of lightning strikes across Perth, expert shares tips for avoiding injury
item.description: After a day that saw 10,000 lightning strikes across Perth, three people suffer injuries, and a pet dog killed, an expert shares tips for avoiding injury during electrical storms.

item.title: How young people are coping with the rising cost of living
item.description: Many people are struggling with the cost of living and increasingly, young Australians say they are not just worried about the situation now, but also what it means for the future.

item.title: 'Child first, offender second' approach to Tasmania's young offenders unveiled
item.description: The Tasmanian government announces a "child first, offender second" approach for the operation of a new youth prison, which it says will offer small "home-like" accommodation for detainees.

item.title: Kimberley man faces Broome court on 18 domestic violence charges
item.description: West Australian police have charged a Kimberley man over alleged domestic violence offences stretching over two decades.

item.title: Foreign nationals arrested following probe into alleged money laundering scheme in Mildura
item.description: Four foreign nationals have been arrested and bank accounts worth more than $3.3 million have been seized as part of what police say is a "sophisticated money laundering operation" in Mildura.

item.title: Charles Darwin University scraps London campus plans following vice-chancellor resignation
item.description: Charles Darwin University has ditched its plan to establish a campus in London after investing nearly $2 million in the proposal.

item.title: Police reinstate murder charge against alleged killer of Kaiden Morgan-Johnston
item.description: Police have reinstated murder charges against a man accused of killing an 18-year-old in Victoria's east last year.

item.title: Super Bowl winner Michael Dickson puts Matt Burton's boot up with NFL punters
item.description: Australian Super Bowl winner Michael Dickson says the booming boot of Bulldogs five-eighth Matt Burton could cut it in the NFL, but not without some major adjustments.

item.title: Perth mother blames WA's mental health systemic failures for her teen daughter's death
item.description: The mother of a teenage girl who took her own life a few hours after being released from a Perth mental health ward says a series of systemic failures is responsible for her daughter's death.

item.title: Deputy Chief of Army delivers speech at Parliament House
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Deputy chief of army warns ADF has become 'detached' from violent nature of war
item.description: Major General Chris Smith delivered an excoriating address to a major conference last year, declaring "managerial and advertising logic and double speak" had "polluted" the military.

item.title: Family of David Collisson who was burned after being shot dead tells of struggle to deal with trauma
item.description: The son, sister and mother of David Collisson who was murdered near Mudgee speak of their unimaginable pain in coming to terms with how he died.

item.title: Murder accused argues self-defence after alleged Dubbo drug hunt ends in death
item.description: A man who stands accused in fatal stabbing that broke out over an alleged drug-related dispute pleads his innocence on grounds of self-defence.

item.title: What to check out this weekend: Gorillaz, Chris Fleming and a pasta salad
item.description: Looking for something diverting for the weekend? We've got you covered.

item.title: Liberal Party will not publish its internal review into the 2025 election loss
item.description: The review received hundreds of submissions and was finished months ago, but today the Liberal Party's federal executive revealed it would never be made public.

item.title: Police foil alleged terror attack plan on public buildings
item.description: Police have charged a 20-year-old man they allege was planning a "mass casualty" terror attack targeting public buildings and Muslim places of worship in Western Australia.

item.title: Parents charged with manslaughter after Gold Coast crash kills 3yo boy
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: House of Darwin founder Shaun Edwards faces court on domestic violence charges
item.description: The founder of popular fashion label House of Darwin has faced court on assault, choking, and strangling charges after an alleged domestic violence incident last year.

item.title: Ex-Liberal MP Rory Amon denies sexual assault complainant told him he was 15
item.description: Former Liberal MP Rory Amon has told a jury the complainant in his sexual assault trial told him he was 17 before they discussed meeting up.

item.title: Federal Court orders South West Aboriginal Medical Service board be dismissed, new election at AGM
item.description: The Federal Court has dismissed the entire board of one of WA's largest Aboriginal medical services, due to factional and 'oppressive conduct'.

item.title: Ex-SA Liberal leader David Speirs says he will contest state election, 10 months after drug conviction
item.description: Former SA Liberal leader David Speirs has confirmed he has nominated to run in his former seat of Black in the state election, 10 months after he was convicted of drug supply offences.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup 2026: Katrina Gorry has done it all for the Matildas. Now she wants a trophy
item.description: Katrina Gorry embodies all the characteristics that are celebrated in Australian football, and the veteran midfielder wants to lead the Matildas all the way to the Asian Cup trophy.

item.title: Evidence concludes in coronial inquest into three-year-old's Alice Springs house fire death
item.description: The inquest into three-year-old Mitchell Thomas's death in an Alice Springs house fire in 2023 has finished hearing evidence, with the coroner examining standards of maintenance, record-keeping and electrical safety regulation in the NT's public housing.

item.title: Teenage boy dies after being hit by two cars crossing busy road in Warnbro
item.description: A teenage boy has died after he was hit by two cars on a busy dual-lane road in Perth's southern suburbs.

item.title: David Speirs's comeback attempt is a risk for everyone — including himself
item.description: The former opposition leader's attempt at a political comeback is a risk for both the major parties — but also himself.

item.title: Queensland Reds defeat Highlanders, Western Force beat Moana Pasifika in Super Rugby
item.description: The Queensland Reds and Western Force have recorded their first wins of the Super Rugby Pacific season in round three.

item.title: An unexpected baby boy gives hope to the all-female Akuntsu tribe in Brazil's Amazon rainforest
item.description: As they advanced in age without a child to carry on the line, many expected the Akuntsu to vanish when the three remaining women died.

item.title: Native title holders awarded more than $54m for economic, spiritual loss from NT's McArthur River Mine
item.description: Native title holders in the Northern Territory have been awarded more than $54 million in compensation for the impacts of large-scale mining on their country, in just the second case of its kind in Australian history.

item.title: Georgia Voll blazes century as Australia defeats India by five wickets and takes 6-4 series lead
item.description: Georgia Voll strikes her second ODI century after being dropped on 99, as Australia cruises to a five-wicket win over India and takes a 6-4 lead in the multi-format series.

item.title: Friday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Islamic State claims credit for Bondi massacre
item.description: Islamic State has embraced Sajid and Naveed Akram as "soldiers" and urged other supporters to continue attacks on Jews and Christians, as they claimed credit for the Bondi massacre.
